title: Petrobras Cuts Capex Plan on Lower Oil Prices
summary: Brazil’s energy major Petrobras has revised its spending plans for the next five years, prompted by the steady and persistent decline in oil prices. The company now plans to spend 2% less than previously expected over the period between 2026 and 2030. Petrobras will also pay less dividend, Reuters …

title: CME trading halt disrupts global markets
summary: Chicago-based exchange hit by fault at data centre, stopping futures trading in equities, bonds and commodities

title: U.S. LNG Exports Set to Surge 40% as Europe Buys Record Volumes
summary: Exports of liquefied natural gas from the United States are on track to book a 40% annual increase this month, hitting 10.7 million tons, projections from Kpler have shown, as cited by Bloomberg. An ample supply of liquefied gas has already pushed natural gas prices down in Europe, with prices reac…

title: UK Auto Production Plunges 31% as Cyberattack and Weak Exports Bite
summary: UK automotive production plunged in October, with combined car and commercial vehicle output falling 30.9% year-on-year to 62,116 units, according to new data released by the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT). The sharp contraction reflects both the ongoing fallout from a major cybe…

title: Nigeria Boosts Gas Supply With OML 17 Output Surge
summary: The Nigerian National Petroleum Company (NNPC) and its partner, Heirs Energies, have successfully doubled natural gas production at a key oil block, OML 17, as part of a broader strategy to boost domestic supply and ease the country's electricity shortages. title: Deutsche Börse launches €5.3bn bid for private equity-backed Allfunds
summary: German exchange group in exclusive discussions with Dutch-listed fund platform
